Class TransactionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • TransactionManager

  • public class TransactionManager
extends java.lang.Object

    Transaction Manager

    The TransactionManager assigns each Operation provided by the user's text file or Operation entered directly by the user. The TransactionManager reads the parsed Operation and determines if it is a begin, beginRO, read, write, dump, fail, recover, end. Depending on the Operation, the TransactionManager executes an action.

      • assignTransaction

        public void assignTransaction(java.lang.String operationLine)
        assignTransaction: assigns operations (a tick from the text file or user input (i.e. begin(T1)) to perform an Operation
        Parameters:
        an - operation such as (i.e. begin(T1), end(T1), W(T1, x4, 200), beginRO(T1), R(T1, x2), dump(), dump(x4), dump(4), fail(1), recover(1))

      • abort

        public void abort(Transaction youngestTransaction)
        abort: This function aborts a Transaction. Whenever a Transaction aborts, if the Transaction has done a write operation, we revert the intermediate value of the Variable back to its original value.
        Parameters:
        youngestTransaction - - the youngest Transaction in the deadlock cycle

        dump: dumps information about all the Site(s) to the standard output
